Pay Online
Stay Notified
Public Notices
Catch the Bus
Parks & Rec



  1. We have a proud history and promising future of providing the world’s leading food brands, research and training.  The city is revitalizing its downtown to accommodate food science and other innovation industries.  Nearby rivers and forests, numerous parks and recreational opportunities, and the world-class Binder Park Zoo make our city a family-friendly area for outdoor play.

    LEARN MORE

  1. Public invited to clean up Linear Park for Earth Day

    Participants can start from five organized locations on April 28. Learn More

  2. City develops, adopts Sustainability Plan

    Themes and goals to help city protect resources, reach more sustainable practices. Learn More

  3. City joins challenge for water conservation in April

    Neighbors encouraged to pledge efficient water use, with chance to win prizes. Learn More

  4. Curbside yard waste begins on Monday

    Program for neighbors inside city limits lasts through Nov. 29. Learn More

  5. City holds online rain barrel sale

    Anyone can purchase rain barrels, composters, and accessories. Learn More

  6. City moving to every-other-week curbside recycling May 6

    Informational brochure coming in April water bills. Learn More

  7. Clean Water Partner calendars now available; event dates set

    Many environmental dates set for Battle Creek, Calhoun County. Learn More

  8. No injuries in vacant office building fire

    Fire was in exterior light fixture. Learn More

  9. Lightning probable cause of small airport fire

    No injuries reported. Learn More

  10. No injuries in Kellogg's plant fire

    Fire contained to one cereal bin and transfer pipe. Learn More

  11. City invites community feedback on downtown lot

    No redevelopment pending, but input will help guide future, potential redevelopment. Learn More

  12. City offices closed for Good Friday

    Transit buses and vans running, Waste Management to make pickups. Learn More

  13. Battle Creek named All-America City finalist

    Community members will travel to Denver to promote city for second year in a row. Learn More

  14. Youth Advisory Board seeking new members

    Group looking for reps of youth voice in Battle Creek, ages 14 to 20. Learn More

  15. Local income tax returns mailing to Battle Creek

    2018 forms, instructions now available online, at City Hall. Learn More

  16. Heritage Tower work now requires complete road closure

    Closure likely to last until spring; detour on Van Buren Street. Learn More

  17. Registration open for spring, summer Rec programs

    Camps and sports available for all ages. Learn More

  18. BCPD parking blocked for next construction phase

    Visitors can access parking across Division at Commerce Pointe. Learn More

  19. City begins new pet licensing program with online option

    Program with DocuPet allows new options for licensing, perks for pet owners. Learn More

  20. Annual hydrant flushing starts Sunday night, April 7

    City Water crews will begin the annual fire hydrant flushing program Sunday night, April 7 – earlier than usual. Learn More
View All

/Calendar.aspx
  1. Events

  1. Sat Apr. 27

    Lakeview Little League Parade (Opening Ceremony) Yearly Lakeview Youth Association Little League parade walf for opening day ceremony.
    LEARN MORE

  2. Wed May 15

    Ride of Silence On May 15, 2019 at 7:00 PM, the Ride of Silence will traverse and unite the globe as nothing before it. Cyclists will take to the roads in a silent procession to honor cyclists who have been killed or injured while cycling on public roadways. Although cyclists have a legal right to share the road with motorists, the motoring public often isn't aware of these rights, and sometimes not aware of the cyclists themselves. The Ride of Silence is a free ride that asks its cyclists to ride no faster ...
    LEARN MORE

  3. Fri May 17

    Bike to Work Day Ditch the car for a day and head to work via pedal power! On Friday, May 17, 2019 the Bicycle Advisory Committee invites you to celebrate bicycling as a clean, fun and healthy way to get to work. All bicyclists are welcome to join one of two convoys, led by members of the Bicycle Advisory Committee. Routes start at Culver's Restaurant on Beckley Road or at the entrance to Bailey Park on Capital Avenue NE. Both routes end at at Mike's Team Active Bikes on W Michigan Avenue (parking will be in r...
    LEARN MORE
View All
/Calendar.aspx
  1. Facebook
  2. Twitter
  1. Facebook
City of Battle Creek, Michigan - Municipal Government
  1. Twitter
Tweets by @BattleCreekCity


  1. Annual Hydrant Flushing

    The city's Water Division begins the annual hydrant flushing program the night of Sunday, April 7 -- that's early this year to accommodate other project schedules and finish before the main construction season begins. Crews will work overnight though May 10 to complete this work. Flushing the hydrants each year allows us to make sure we're delivering the highest quality of water to you, gives us another way to check on our water distribution system, and ensures hydrants are working properly for the Fire Department. See daily progress maps at the link!

    Learn More

  1. 2018 Tax Time

    The time has come again to begin filing 2018 tax returns. For those filing local tax returns with the City of Battle Creek, please click the link below to visit our Income Tax Office web page. You will find a variety of instructions and forms -- many of which are fillable PDFs -- as well as the link to file your local taxes online. Local tax forms are due to the city by April 30. All paper forms should be mailed to Battle Creek City Income Tax, PO Box 1657, Battle Creek, MI 49016-1657.

    Learn More


  1. Find your recycling week!

    Starting the week of May 6, City of Battle Creek neighbors will have every-other-week curbside recycling pickup. You will keep the same pickup day, but you will be green or yellow recycling weeks. Click the link below to go directly to the map where you can enter your address and find your week. More info is at our trash/recycling web page, or you can call Waste Management with questions, 866-797-9018.

    Learn More

Contact Us

  1. City of Battle Creek
    10 N. Division St.
    Battle Creek, MI, 49014
    Contact Us By Phone




    Employees Only
